com.turn.shapeshifter

Class AutoSchema

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.turn.shapeshifter.AutoSchema
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Schema

    public class AutoSchema
extends Object
implements Schema
    AutoSchema instances are schemas of the simplest kind. They can be used in contexts where the customization of the external representation of a type is either not needed or undesirable. As such, the implementation of such a schema's Parser and Serializer are lean and fast.

    Default conversions and conventions still apply for the Parser and Serializer returned by an instance of this class. Namely:

    • Field names are converted between Protocol Buffer lower_underscore to JSON's camelCase.
    • Enum names are converted between PROTO_FORMAT and jsonFormat.
    • Empty arrays and objects without properties are ignored

    An instance of AutoSchema is anonymous and defined uniquely by the Descriptors.Descriptor from which it was instantiated. Since Protocol Buffer message descriptors are immutable, instances of this class are prime candidates for being cached throughout the lifetime of an application.

    This class takes its name from its use within the Shapeshifter library, where instances of this class are generated on the fly as other schema types find the need to handle types for which no schema was defined by the user.

    Instances of this class recursively build schemas for all message types referred from the root descriptor. This is impossible to achieve when a loop occurs in the descriptors. Assuming an instance of this class is built with the descriptor for a message named ProtoA, an exception will be thrown when:

    • ProtoA contains a field of type ProtoA
    • ProtoA contains a field a type ProtoB, and ProtoB contains a field of type ProtoA.
    • More generally when there exists a chain of fields between ProtoA and ProtoX, and ProtoX refers to any message type that is part of that chain, including ProtoA and ProtoX themselves.
    Author:
    jsilland
